result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan W. Stricker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Pay Blood Draw costs and DNA surcharge on Count 1.
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration program.
Eligible for Substance Abuse program, after 3 years of confinement.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs.
Do not consume or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and then only as prescribed.
Do not be in taverns, bars, or any other similar facility where the primary source of income is from the sale and/or distribution of alcoholic beverages, unless within the scope of employment, and then only with consent of agent.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full at least 90 days prior to discharge, or set up a payment plan.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA sample for testing if not already completed.
Complete an AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes: No DNA surcharges ordered for Counts 2 & 3 reasons stated on the record.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

of Sentencing Hearing held on November 11, 2016

Defendant Alan W. Stricker in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Alan W. Stricker in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:05 pm  Court calls the case. Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
This matter is before the court for sentencing.

Court has received the Department of Corrections Pre-Sentence Investigation.
Atty Knaapen has received the PSI and does not have any corrections.
Atty Sheets has received the PSI and notes a small number of corrections for the record.
Court makes corrections on his copy of the PSI.

Court also received two correspondence on November 9th.
Atty Knaapen has received a copy of the letters.
Atty Sheets has received a copy of the letters.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court re: sentencing recommendations.
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court re: sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:

Count 1:
Prison Sentence 7 years -  4 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision, concurrent to any other sentence currently serving.
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration program.
Eligible for Substance Abuse program, after 3 years of confinement.
Conditions of supervision:
Complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs.
Do not consume or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and then only as prescribed.
Do not be in taverns, bars, or any other similar facility where the primary source of income is from the sale and/or distribution of alcoholic beverages, unless within the scope of employment, and then only with consent of agent.
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full at least 90 days prior to discharge, or set up a payment plan.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA sample for testing if not already completed.
3 years Revocation of License
3 years Ignition Interlock Device
Fine of $600 + costs
$26.45 Blood Draw Fee
Pay DNA surcharge
100 days jail credit

Count 2:
6 month jail sentence, concurrent with Count 1
100 days jail credit
Pay costs
Court does not order the DNA surcharge for reasons stated on the record.

Count 3:
30 days jail sentence, concurrent with Counts 1 & 2
100 days jail credit
Pay costs
Court does not order the DNA surcharge for reasons stated on the record.

Court provides a written determination of prison sentence to Defendant.
Court advises Defendant of appeals rights.

3:18 pm  Case concluded.
Defendant's Notice of Motions and Motions in Limine
Sentencing hearing on November 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

David W Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Eric Sheets appeared on behalf of Alan W Stricker.  Alan W Stricker appeared in person. 
Jury Trial - Day 2 
Clerk: jb
8:45 am  Court calls case.  Attorneys state their appearances.
Court did meet with the attorneys before court re: preliminary jury instructions.
Exhibit #6 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.
8:47 am  Jurors are escorted into the courtroom. All 13 jurors are present.
8:48 am  Clerk swears in Deputy Mulrooney.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
Exhibit #6 is referred to during testimony.
Witness identified Defendant.
9:41 am  Cross examination by Atty Sheets.
Exhibit #6 is referred to during testimony.
10:13 am  Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.
10:17 am  Re-cross by Atty Sheets.
Atty Knaapen moves for the admission of Exhibit #6.
BY THE COURT: Admitted.
10:22 am  State rests. Court will take a break and resume in 15-20 minutes.
10:22 am  Juror are escorted out of the courtroom.
Court states counsel reached a Stipulation re: certain elements the State has to prove and states the two facts.
Court gives Defendant his rights to have the jury decide on those elements.
Court questions Defendant.
Defendant responds.
Court questions Atty Sheets re: if Defendant understands his rights and is giving up his rights freely, voluntarily and knowingly.
Court is satisfied and finds that Defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently waived his right to a jury trial on those elements.
Court questions Atty Sheets re: Defendant testifying.
Court gives Defendant his rights to testify.
Defendant states he is not testifying.
Court questions Atty Sheets.
Atty Sheets responds.
Court is satisfied and finds that Defendant has knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived his right to testify.
Clerk accounts for all exhibits and states which exhibits have been admitted.
Atty Knaapen requests Exhibits #3 and #4 to be admitted.
BY THE COURT: Admitted.
Court addresses the jury instructions.
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court.
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court.
Atty Sheets makes additional arguments to the Court.
Atty Knaapen makes additional arguments to the Court.
Court will change the title to Statements/Admissions.
Court addresses another jury instruction.
10:42 am  Court is in recess for another 10 minutes.
11:01 am  Court is back in session.
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.
Atty Sheets makes statements to the Court.
11:02 am  Jurors are escorted into the courtroom. All 13 jurors are present.
11:04 am  A. Stricker is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Sheets.
11:06 am  Atty Knaapen has no questions.
11:07 am  Dr. R. Tovar is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Sheets.
Exhibits #7 and #8 are marked on behalf of Defendant and referred to during testimony.
Atty Sheets requests a sidebar.
Exhibit #5 is referred to during testimony.
Exhibit #9 is marked on behalf of Defendant and referred to during testimony.
11:24 am  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court.
Court questions Atty Sheets.
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court.
Atty Sheets makes additional arguments to the Court.
11:33 am  Jurors are escorted into the courtroom. All 13 jurors are present.
Direct examination by Atty Sheets continues.
11:51 am  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court.
Atty Sheets makes arguments to the Court.
11:57 am  Jurors are escorted into the courtroom. All 13 jurors are present.
Direct examination by Atty Sheets continues.
12:05 pm  Cross examination by Atty Knaapen.
Exhibit #9 is referred to during testimony.
12:21 pm  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
Court is in recess until 1:25 pm.
Clerk accounts for the exhibits.

Clerk: ep
1:28 p.m. case is back in session.  Parties as they were before we took a break.
The witness is asked to take the witness stand and reminded he is still under oath.  The record reflects that all 13 jurors have returned to the courtroom.  ADA Knaapen cross examination continues.  Starts1:37 Exhibit #3 at 4:57 -and stopped at 9:46, cross examination continues by ADA Knaapen.  1:37 p.m.  Redirect by Attorney Sheets.  
1:51 p.m.  cross exam by ADA Knaapen.  
1:54 p.m.  The testimony has completed.  Court instructs the jurors that they are working on the jury instructions.  1:55 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
Court reviews the jury instructions with the attorneys.  Bailiff provides the attorneys and court with updated jury instructions.  Court continues to review the proposed jury instructions.  
2:15 p.m.  Court is in recess.  2:40 p.m. Case is back on the record.  Appearances remain the same.  Jurors are not in the courtroom.  Court has made corrections to the jury instructions.  Court makes brief statement of instructions.  State is satisfied and defense attorney is satisfied and has no furhter objections.  
Court states there was side bar re: Dr. Tovar's employment.  Court did allow testimony re: law enforcement employment.  Court did sustain objection as it was further than scope of the questions.  2:44 p.m.  All 13 jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  Court reads the jury instructions to the jury.  

3:05 p.m.  ADA Knaapen gives closing statement.  
3:22 p.m.  Attorney Sheets gives closing statement.  3:48 p.m.  ADA Knaapen makes a rebuttal statement.  4:00 p.m.  Court addresses the jurors regarding reaching a verdict.
Juror #2223 is drawn as the alternate.
Oath of Officers is administered by the clerk.  Court thanks Juror #2223 for her service.
4:07 p.m.  jurors are escorted out of the courtroom to begin deliberation.  Court states it does not provide exhibit unless requested by the jurors.
Attorney Sheets requests all exhibits be admitted that have not been previously admitted.
BTC:  Court admits Exhibit #7, 8 and 9 without objections and any other exhibits not admitted at this time.
5:47 p.m. Court is back on the record.  The appearances are stated on the record.  The court has received a note from the jury - asking to see certain exhibits (entire video and medical records).  ADA Knaapen responds to the request of the jury.  Attorney Sheets responds to the request of the jury.  BTC:  The court agrees with the statement of Attorney Sheets that only certain portions were played and there is no redacted video for them to view.  The court will not allow to review the video but to rely on your collective memory.  The court will not send the medical records.  
ADA Knaapen makes additional statement.  Attorney Sheets makes additional statement.  
Court provides the attorneys with the response that will be given to the jury, both attorneys agree with the response to be returned to the jury.  5:56 p.m.  Court is in recess.  6:06 p.m.  Court is back on the record.  The court has been advised that the jury has reached a verdict.  6:08 p.m.  The jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  The Court reads the verdict form 
Count 1 Guilty - OWI 
Count 2 Guilty - operating while revoke
Count 3 Guilty - obstructing an officer
Verdict is dated today's date and signed by the foreperson.  

Attorney Sheets requests the jury to be polled on count 1.  All jurors polled individually.
6:12 p.m.  Court excuses jury

ADA requests the judgment on all 3 counts.  
ADA defers to court re: PSI and Attorney Sheets requests a PSI.  

BTC:  Court orders a PSI and sets the matter for a sentencing hearing on 

ADA requests the bond be revoked and defendant taken into custody.  Attorney Sheets replies.  

BTC:  Court revokes the bond and remades him to the custody of Portage County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Attorney Sheets requests he be able to go to his medical appointments.

BTC:  Court will allow the defendant to go to medical appointments if allowed by the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  

6:20 p.m.  Court is in recess.

David W Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Eric Sheets appeared on behalf of Alan W Stricker.  Alan W Stricker appeared in person. 
Jury Trial - Day One 
Clerk: sp
8:41 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Court welcomes the Juror's and informs them of what their duties are to be a Juror.
8:48 a.m.  Clerk administers Voir Dire Oath.
23 potential Juror's are chosen - 2198, 2234, 2275, 2236, 2242, 2251, 2229, 2200, 2217, 2261, 2250, 2239, 2312, 2168, 2270, 2169, 2315, 2223, 2289, 2199, 2238, 2302, 2252.
8:53 a.m.  Court administers Voir Dire.
Potential witnesses for the State may be - Portage County Deputy Joseph Mulrooney, Samantha Tracy, Stevens Point Officer Aaron Yenter and Stevens Point Officer Justin Klein.   Other potential witnesses that may be called are Amy Goedert (analyst with crime lab), Portage County Deputy Brad Mathwich,  Amy Stricker and Dr Richard Tovar.
9:06 a.m.  Atty Knaapen administers Voir Dire.
9:27 a.m.  Atty Sheets administers Voir Dire. 
9:52 a.m.  Atty Knaapen requests a sidebar. 
9:55 a.m.  Court has a couple of follow up questions for Voir Dire.
9:57 a.m.  Atty Knaapen has no follow up questions for Voir Dire.
Atty Sheets has follow up questions for Voir Dire.
The parties will be allowed 5 strikes each to bring the Juror's down to 13.
Parties proceed with their peremptory strikes.
Court informs the Juror's of the process that will follow once the 13 Juror's are chosen.
10:10 a.m.  Court informs the potential Jurors that there will be an alternate Juror chosen but will not be known until the end of the trial.
10:13 a.m.  Clerk reads the13 chosen jurors to the Court.
13 chosen Juror's - 2169, 2199, 2200, 2223, 2236, 2242, 2251, 2261, 2270, 2289, 2302, 2312 and 2315.
Juror's not chosen are excused to the back of the courtroom.
10:15 a.m.  Clerk administers the Juror's Oath. 
Clerk advises the Juror's of what will be required of them.
Court thanks the remaining Juror's and that they are discharged from further service today.
Selected Juror's are taken to the Jury Room. 
10:17 a.m.  Record reflects that the Juror's have left the courtroom and the Juror's are acceptable to both parties.
10:18 a.m.  Court is in a 5 minute recess..
10:30 a.m.  Court is back in session - appearances remain the same.
Court received a Motion in Limine from defense counsel and will address it at this time on the record.
Atty Sheets informs the Court that his client will not be testifying.
10:53 a.m.  Court questions the defendant - defendant's waiver for a Jury Trial on the element stated on the record is granted.
11:01 a.m.   Juror's have returned to the courtroom.
Court addresses the Juror's that they will be able to take notes if they choose and will receive a pencil/notepad.
11:03 a.m.  Atty Knaapen makes his opening statement.
11:13 a.m.  Atty Sheets makes his opening statement.
11:22 a.m.  Witness (S. T.) is sworn in.
11:23 a.m.  Bailiff provides notepads to the Jurors.
11:24 a.m.  Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
11:30 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Sheets.
11:31 a.m.  Witness is excused from her subpoena and allowed to leave.
11:32 a.m.  Officer Aaron Yenter is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
Witness identifies the defendant.  
 11:58 a.m.  Exhibit #1 (Informing the Accused) is marked for Atty Knaapen and referenced.
11:59 a.m.  Exhibit #2 (Alcohol Influence Report) is marked for Atty Knaapen and referenced.
Atty Knaapen moves Exhibit #1 & #2 into evidence; no objection by Atty Sheets.  Received by the Court.
Juror's are informed that they are not to discuss this case with anyone and not to use any form of social media.
Record reflects that the Juror's have left the Courtroom; witness is excused until this afternoon.
Atty Sheets questions audio/video equipment.
12:04 p.m.  Court is in recess until 1:15 p.m  

Clerk:  ep
1:19 p.m. case is back in session.  The parties are as they were before the lunch break and the jurors are not in the courtroom.  Attorney Sheet makes statement re: playing video.  Court makes notice that the Court reporter will not transcribe the video testimony.  

1:28 p.m. jurors are escorted in courtroom.  Court reflects all jurors have returned.  Officer Yenter is reminded that he is still under oath.  Attorney Sheets examines the witness.  
Attorney Sheets refers to Exhibit #3 - Video is started at 34 seconds (shown at bottom of screen) and stopped at 1:07.  Cross examination continues by Attorney Sheets.  
Exhibit #3 is started at 3:37 and stopped at various times and ending at 9:53 (4:12 til 5:53; 5:53 - 6:09 and started at 6:09 - ending at 9:53.)

2:34 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Knaapen.  Refers to Exhibit #2.  
Refers to Exhibit #3 - starts at 6:09 and stops at 6:39.  
Re-cross examination by Attorney Sheets.
2:52 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.  Court is in recess until 3:05 p.m.

3:06 p.m. Court is back on the record.  Court advises it has an emergency meeting at 4:30 p.m. and must conclude prior to 4:30 p.m. today.  3:08 p.m.  All 13 jurors are back in the courtroom.  ADA calls next witness, clerk swears in the witness.  (A.Goedert.)  ADA examines the witness.  Refers to Exhibit #5 in examination.  3:38 p.m.  Attorney Sheets cross examines the witness.  Refers to Exhibit #2   3:54 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Knaapen.  3:58 p.m.  Re-cross by Attorney Sheets. 

Exhibit #5 is admitted without objection by Attorney.  4:00 p.m.  ADA calls next witness, Clerk swears in the witness (Deputy Brad Mathwich), examination by ADA Knaapen.  Witness identifies the defendant.   4:07 p.m. cross examine by Attorney Sheets.  4:08 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Knaapen.  
4:09 p.m.  ADA calls witness, clerk swears in the witness (Officer J. Klein).  Examination by ADA Knaapen.  Witness identifies the defendant.  4:14 p.m.  cross examination by Attorney Sheets.  4:17 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Knaapen.  Follow up by Attorney Sheets.
4:20 p.m.  Court avises the jurors nto to do any research on their own, do not discuss this matter with anyone until directed to do so.  Court stands at recess until 8:30 a.m. tomorrow.  Court asks the jurors to take the notebooks to the jury room where they will be collected by the bailiffs.  The jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.
There was sidebar during voire dire re: #2250.  Parties did agree and followed up with the questions.  Juror #2250 was struck during final selection.  Court will put the note into the file for future reference.  Court reviewed the proposed jury instructions and asks counsel to look at proposed instruction and will address before 8:30 trial.  Counsel to be present at 8:15 a.m. to review jury instructions.  
4:25 p.m.  One more witness to be called by ADA   Court questions the defense attorney re: witness tomorrow.
in Limine filed by Atty Sheets

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
